Sentencas: In this paper, a dynamic model of a single tubular solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) unit is developed using the control volume (CV) approach.
Titulo: Dynamic modeling of single tubular SOFC combining heat/mass transfer and electrochemical reaction effects

Sentencas: The heat transfer, species transportation, and electrochemical reaction effects are taken into account in a collective manner.
Titulo: Dynamic modeling of single tubular SOFC combining heat/mass transfer and electrochemical reaction effects

Sentencas: Using this model, we study the spatial distributions of a series of state variables under both steady-state and transient operations and evaluate the system dynamic behavior.
Titulo: Dynamic modeling of single tubular SOFC combining heat/mass transfer and electrochemical reaction effects

Sentencas: The analysis shows that there exists non-uniform current contribution and Nernst potential distribution along the longitudinal direction, caused by the non-uniform fuel/gas partial pressures along the flow direction and the temperature distribution in the anode/cathode channel and cell body, for example.
Titulo: Dynamic modeling of single tubular SOFC combining heat/mass transfer and electrochemical reaction effects

Sentencas: The classical Nernst potential relation is revised to capture the characteristics of the fuel cell under time varying external load voltage.
Titulo: Dynamic modeling of single tubular SOFC combining heat/mass transfer and electrochemical reaction effects

Sentencas: Comprehensive numerical simulations are carried out to explore the underlying dynamic properties in typical SOFC operations.
Titulo: Dynamic modeling of single tubular SOFC combining heat/mass transfer and electrochemical reaction effects

Sentencas: The numerical study is also correlated to experimental results such as the polarization curve and power density, which shows good agreement.
Titulo: Dynamic modeling of single tubular SOFC combining heat/mass transfer and electrochemical reaction effects
